content.description:
Climb through the first two bolts on

Early Warning

, and then veer left and climb up into the base of a sheer prow. Climb up the center of the overhanging prow, and work your way through the technical face climbing just left of the bolt line to reach the chains at its top. Try to avoid going seismic on the finishing moves.
content.protection: The route is protected with 8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and biners.
content.location:
The route is located on the north side of the East half of Half & Half crag and the start is about 10 feet left of

Fault Line

.

content.description:
'Crags' slab climbing at its best. Sack-up for this one. "It ain't no sport climb - it's a bolted protected rock climb!" (per Mr. Kimball himself) Stellar slab climbing, edges and pasting.

Start on a network of web-like seams in the middle of the wall, followed by a crux roof sequence.

2-bolt anchor over the roof has been added. Â or Scramble over the top and down onto a platform on the SW corner of the Shark Fin.

Extra credit: while there climb the short, 5-bolt, but sweet Yellow Butterfly (5.9+) on Shark Fin.

Walk off, down around to the left (north) to return to the base in a counterclockwise hike. Totally worth the walk.
content.protection: 2 pins and 8 bolts PLUS take some small wire-nuts, and C3s/Aliens up to #0.75 BD.
content.location: This tall gray wall sits directly uphill from Woodstone, on the right (south) side of Half & Half Crag. the route is capped by a small roof at 120'.

content.description:
Climb

Early Warning

to its anchors, and then continue up and left onto a tan face. Climb the face just left of the bolt line, and continue through the bulging red prow at its top to reach the chains.
content.location:
The route is located on the north side of the east half of Half & Half crag, and the start is about 10 feet left of

Fault Line

.

content.description:
Near Miss climbs the first 60 feet of

Direct Hit

for 8 bolts, and then the climber can climb to the right and lower off the anchors on the top of

Close Call

. It is a fun moderate climb with consistent movement on featured rock.
content.location:
The route has the same start as

Direct Hit

.

content.description: From the recessed middle wall, diagonal up and left to a right-facing dihedral, then up a wavy face.
content.location: Within the Alcove, this route sits up in the back of the recess.

content.description: These are pitches 3 & 4 of a much longer link-up named The Golden Staircase. It can be done as its own climb, as can different sections of the Staircase. Check out the climbs under the Woodstone and The Druid formations for other sections of the route.
content.protection:
I don't remember an exact bolt count, but 14 or 15 quickdraws should be enough for the protection bolts and anchors.

Per

Doug Haller

: if you link the pitches, you need 16 draws plus something for the anchors.
content.location:
Start to left of

Rouge Element

(note to editors: the website would not let me order this climb correctly. It is to right of

Half a Man

and the recess mentioned in that route description and to left of

Rouge

).

Pitch 1: climb left edge of slab to semi-hanging belay. This is fun 5.9.

Pitch 2: climb steepening rock, turn the left edge, and climb a headwall

overhanging a deep chasm. It has great position and movement; 11a.

Walk off the top to the south, and circle back to your pack on the west side of Half and Half,

or link Sharksfin,

etc.

content.description: Enter the Fault Line just left of a thin, right-facing crack, and climb up using the crack and face holds on the left. Climb up onto a small ledge, and continue up the inset face right of a flake to a good jug. Make tricky moves upward and left to reach the chains on top of a bulge.
content.protection: The route is protected with 8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and biners.
content.location:
The route is located on the North side of the East half of Half & Half crag, which is within 10 yards of the Woodstone crag. The route is located about 15 feet left of

After Shocks

.

content.description: Begin up the right side of a bulge, and climb up and leftward onto a face. Continue into and through a featured section with cracks, pockets, and crimps. Climb the face above following the bolt line to reach the chains (do not venture out left into a small gully feature).
content.protection: The route is protected with 7 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and biners.
content.location:
The route is located on the north side of the East half of Half & Half crag, which is within 10 yards of the Woodstone crag. It is located about 10 feet left of

Fault Line

.

content.description:
Disruption climbs

Direct Hit

to its anchors and then continues up and left to join the end of

Rouge Element

below the final roof on that climb. Climbing to the anchors on

Rouge Element

yields a 140 foot long climb to reach the top of Half & Half Crag. With a 60m rope ,there are at least two options to climbing Disruption: 1) the leader can belay at the top of Half & Half, and after the 2nd reaches the top, they can both walk off to the south and west or 2) the leader can thread the rings and the belayer can lower him/her to the anchors on

Direct Hit

, the leader can clip in direct there, pull the rope, retie in, and then lower from the anchors on

Direct Hit

to the base of the climb.
content.protection:
The route is protected with 20 bolts (14 bolts plus 1 of the anchor bolts on

Direct Hit

(note: use a long draw or sling with bikers to clip one of the anchor bolts to minimize rope drag), 1 bolt for the linkup section, and 4 bolts on

Rouge Element

). At the end of the climb, there is a 2-bolt anchor with descending rings located at the top of

Rouge Element

.
content.location:
Disruption is a linkup that connects the entire length of

Direct Hit

with the final bolted section of

Rouge Element

.

content.protection: Direct Hit is protected by 14 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and biners. The route is a full 100 foot long pitch, so with a 60m rope, be careful when belaying, and tie a knot in the end of your rope. If needed, the belayer can safely move up onto a short ramp at the start of the climb and clip into the first bolt when lowering the leader.
content.location: Direct Hit is located on the west edge of the north face of Half & Half crag.

content.description:
Start with the first 2 bolts of the route "

Half a Man

" to the ledge. Move to the right side of the ledge, and follow 8 bolts on nice multi-colored stone. Trend left toward the top to join the last bolt of "

Half a Man

", then go up to the anchor shared with "

Half a Man

".

A 60 meter rope is required.

content.protection: 8 bolts and a 2-bolt anchor with chains and steel carabiners.
content.location:
The start of Close Call is located about 15' right of the start for

Direct Hit

.

content.description: This route is on the sharp arete to the north side of the Alcove. The positioning is awesome. Since this route has not seen much traffic, there are still some small suspect flakes. There are good edges with which to work.

pathTokens: Woodstone, Half & Half, and Slot Rock
